thread.title: Quincy livery driver sentenced for raping passenger - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Quincy livery driver sentenced for raping passenger - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Quincy livery driver sentenced for raping passenger - Massachusetts news
text:
BOSTON (AP) — A livery driver from Quincy has been sentenced to up to eight years in prison for raping a woman who got into his vehicle in Boston thinking it was a taxi.
Said Said (sy-EED’ sy-EED') was convicted of charges including aggravated kidnapping, aggravated rape, and larceny.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below The Patriot Ledger (http://bit.ly/1OFZv9x ) reports that prosecutors had sought a 10- to 15-year sentence.
Police say the woman flagged down Said’s vehicle in Boston’s Seaport District on June 2014.
The woman told police the driver took her to a secluded area, sexually assaulted her, and then stole her cellphone and credit cards.
Police identified Said because surveillance cameras at a Quincy gas station and a Dorchester pharmacy showed him using the woman’s credit and debit cards to make purchases hours after the attack.
___
Information from: The (Quincy, Mass.) Patriot Ledger, http://www.patriotledger.com
